Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body, a small sunken discus surrounded by a raised rim and groove, and a raised base-ring, flat within. The long flat-topped nozzle has concave sides and a slightly splayed blunt tip; it is decorated with an acanthus on a double base line and volutes, and has an impressed mark underneath. The shoulder is encircled at the rear by a line of cable pattern with a duck's head at the end. Decorated with a dull red slip.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q595)
